input_description.intro:
============================================================================= CP Post-Processing code (cppp.x) =============================================================================
The cppp.x code is an utility that can be used to extract data from the CP restart and CP trajectory files.
INPUT: =====
the program read the input parameters from the standard input or from any other file specified through the usual "-input" command line flag. The input parameters, in the input file, should be specified in the inputpp namelist follow:
&INPUTPP ... cppp_input_parameter ... /

var.name: prefix
var.info: basename prepended to cp.x output filenames: cp.evp, cp.pos ....

var.name: fileout
var.info: basename of the cppp.x output files

var.name: output
var.info:
a string describing the output format to be performed, allowed values: 'xsf', 'xyz'
xsf xcrysden format xyz XMOL format

var.name: outdir
var.info: directory containing the CP trajectory files (.evp .pos .cel ...) and restart files ( .save ) to be processed

var.name: lcharge
var.info: OBSOLETE - no longer implemented. Use "pp.x" instead.

var.name: lforces
var.info:
This logical flag control the processing of forces.
.TRUE. extract forces from trajectory files and write them to xcrysden file
.FALSE. do not process forces

var.name: ldynamics
var.info:
This logical flag control the processing of atoms trajectory.
.TRUE. process CP trajectory files and generate a trajectory file for xcrysden (.axsf)
.FALSE. do not process trajectory

var.name: lpdb
var.info:
This logical flag control the generation of a pdb file.
.TRUE. generate a pdb file containing positions and cell of the simulated system
.FALSE. do not generate pdb file

var.name: lrotation
var.info:
This logical flag control the rotation of the cell
.TRUE. rotate the system cell in space in order to have the a lattice parameter laying on the x axis, the b lattice parameter laying on the xy plane
.FALSE. do not rotate cell

vargroup.info:
Number of replicas of atomic positions along cell parameters. CURRENTLY DISABLED
If np1, np2, np3 are 1 or not specified, cppp.x does not replicate atomic positions in space.
If np1, np2, np3 are > 1 cppp.x replicates the atomic positions used in the simulation np1 times along "a", np2 times along "b", np3 times along "c".

var.name: nframes
var.info: number of MD step to be read to build the trajectory CURRENTLY MUST BE > 1

var.name: ndr
var.info: CP restart file number to post process

dimension.name: atomic_number
dimension.info:
Specify the atomic number of the species in CP trajectory and restart file.
atomic_number(1) specify the atomic number of the first specie atomic_number(2) specify the atomic number of the second specie ....
